question: 4 (b)
sols_html:
Lagrange’s Remainder Formula states that:

\[\begin{aligned} R_n(x) &=f(x)-T_n(x) \\ &= \frac{f^{(n+1)}(c)}{(n+1)!}(x-a)^{(n+1)}\end{aligned}\]

Where \(c\) is a number in \([x, a].\)

When \(R_n(x)\) is positive, then \(T_n(x)\) is an underestimate; if it is negative, then \(T_n(x)\) is an overestimate. For this problem,

\[\begin{aligned} f(x) &=\sqrt[3]{x} = x^{1/3} \\ f'(x) &=\frac{1}{3x^{2/3}}\\ f''(x) &= -\frac{2}{9x^{5/3}}\\ f'''(x) &= \frac{10}{(27 x^{8/3})} \\ (x-a)^{(n+1)} &= (8.1-8)^3 = 0.001\end{aligned}\]

Since \(f(8.1)\) and \((x-a)^{n+1}\) are both positive, we can conclude that \(R_n(8.1)\) is also positive since the factorial is positive as well. This means that:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle T_2(8.1)<\sqrt[3]{8.1}\end{aligned}\]
